terribly bugged game. nothing adequately explains why your progress is not saved, nor does it provide permanent solutions to your game reseting everytime a map change occurs. been playing for a while, and my characters remain low leveled because no progress is saved at all. no further support is provided, making this game merely a cash grab.

This is a classic. I won't talk too much about it because there is more than enough content out there to see what's up with this game but here are the beest parts.

[list]
[*]Tight controlls. Feel very nice to play which is important for a FPS game.
[*]Up to 6 players coop. That's 2 more than most game. Tons of fun to play with friends.
[*]Amazing maps. Some are classics, other have unique and amazing features.
[*]Different ennemies. You have to know what to do and when or you'll end up stucked, you rib open.
[*]6 classes with unique gameplay.
[*]Slow motion.
[*]Mods.
[/list]

The second Killing Floor is just around the corner and straight up better from what I've seen but if your crew can't afford it, this is a nice alternative. A classic of coop fps.

gameplay: es un fps asique no hay mucho que decir en cuanto la jugabilidad que no se alla dicho antes, son controles simples y faciles de aprender y maniobrar, incluso yo que los fps no son lo mio logre adecuarme perfectamente a los controles, lo unico que me incomodo un poco es el hecho de tener que hagacharme con la letra c y no con ctrl o tirar granadas con la letra g pero todas estas funciones se pueden cambiar en el menu de ajustes asique se podria decir que estamos bien en cuanto a gameplay

musica: lo he dicho antes y lo digo ahora, para mi la musica de un videojuego es uno de los puntos en los que mas estricto hay que ser pues una banda sonora acompaÃ±ando un momento especifico del juego puede convertirse en uno de los momentos mas memorables que el juego tiene para ofrecer, como es el caso de undertale (por poner un ejemplo reciente) en el caso de killing floor el metal que suena de fondo es mas que suficiente para mostrar lo epico que puede llegar a ser el estar enfrentandote a un peloton de crawlers, goefasts, sirens, etc con solo una pistola o ya de plano algo mas pesado como un lanzallamas, una escopeta o el arma definitiva, la motosierra, simplemente una obra maestra

soporte multijugador: killing floor precenta el multijugador como su punto fuerte, muy pocas partidas me han salido con un ping mas alto que 250, que para tratarse de gente estadounidense no esta nada mal, las partidas son muy estables en cuanto a lag, llegando a ser algo con lo que te toparas una vez en todo el juego, ademas este juego cuenta con servidores dedicados, lo cual si lo juntamos con el pack de 6 copias del juego se convierte en la opcion mas viable para jugar con tus amigos en una tarde de tiempo libre siendo que el juego corre en una patata (como la mia) pero si no tienes nadie con quien jugarlo siempre tendras los servidores publicos que tampoco estan nada mal pues muchos de ellos implementan mods, dlc, enemigos con texturas personalizadas, mapas creados por la comunidad, y hasta servidores masivos capases de albergar hasta 20 o 30 jugadores, la unica razon para dejar de jugar esta maravilla es el haber jugado demasiado y por ende tener sueÃ±o ya que has estado jugando todo el dia y a ti se te han hecho 20 minutos

comunidad: la comunidad de killing floor es completamente lo contrario a la de lol, es paciente con los nuevos o los que no se han acostumbrado muy bien a los controles o que ya de plano no tienen una vision de lo que hacer, tanto asi que el multijugador parese tutorial, algo que jamas pero JAMAS habia visto en un juego multijugador, es desir, estamos hablando de un juego en el que el multijugador es tu tutorial pues los jugadores te enseÃ±an desde los controles hasta algunas tacticas esenciales o a usar algunos perks de manera adecuada, simplemente increible

perks: los perks (o priviliegios en espaÃ±ol) son algo asi como la clase, hay una variedad no muy grande pero satisfactoria de perks para elegir, el medico, el sniper, el soporte, el piromano, y algunos otros, cada uno con "misiones" que al completarlas aÃ±aden XP al perk al que pertenesen, de esta manera aumentando las caracteristicas de este, por ejemplo velocidad de movimiento extra, menor tiempo de espera para la jeringuilla medica, soldar puertas mas rapido, mayor daÃ±o al disparar a la cabeza, etc etc y mas etc, pero eso no es todo, diferentes perks tienen diferentes armas para comprar, por ejemplo si elegiste el perk de sniper, no puedes comprar armas cuerpo a cuerpo (machetes, hachas, espadas y otras tantas mas) de la misma forma si tienes el perk de medico no puedes comprar una escopeta o un rifle, esto en realidad no es un estorbo, es algo util y logico pues es algo similar a lo que hemos visto en team fortress 2 (por poner un ejemplo) el scout no puede poner sentinelas como el ingeniero, el heavy no puede llevar un rifle como el sniper, y la lista sigue y sigue, en resumen, estan cabrones y le dan personalidad al juego

conclusion: killing floor es un fps exepcional que se resume en una palabra, epico, ideal para jugar con amigos, desconocidos o incluso tu solo, ademas contando con mas de 250 logros por desbloquear, se combierte en un reto interesante para esos usuarios a los que les gusta completar los juegos al 100%

nota final: este juego se merece un 10/10, es perfecto, lo tiene todo, accion, metal, mapas varios cada uno con una ambientacion diferente, adrenalina, cientos de logros y horas y horas de diversion sin limites, un juegazo de bajos requisitos que no puedes darte el lujo de no probar

I decided to re-cover my review, since it didn't technically [i]review[/i] anything.

The game itself, as a cooperative First Person Shooter, is a solid 8/10. Thats exceptionally high coming from someone who prefers 2D Sidescrollers. This game provides to you a lot of things you don't often get in survival games. Things including: Genuine Sense of Panic, a Huge Scramble for Money, Bullet management, and target priority.

Your team needs to communicate, especially on higher difficulties.

Map Design is pretty standard, it does keep your intrest. Even the basic ones have hidden tunnels and fun little nooks and crannies to investigate.

The classes are evenly balanced, and they all do play a well-fit role. You may have to play around to see what suits you best. Below included is a difficulty guide, based on my experience.

>Beginner = Easy
>Normal = Difficulty Curve
>Hard = Bring some friends
>Suicide = Use your head.
>Hell on Earth = Cooperation Required.
Nonetheless, Very fun game. With the release of KF2 I doubt many people are playing anymore but I'd still give it a shot. 

Randoms can get hectic, but never toxic.

Do you like gore and blood? Do you like killing monsters with friends? Yes and Yes? Then buy this game to enjoy shooting zeds, many zeds.
kiling floor

The grapics may look simple but this game makes call of duty zombies look like a shallow boring headache. with upto 6 players at once and big open (or closed in) maps and a class and level up system with tons of weapons it is a very fun game, one of the best in terms of zombie shooting, but you need other people to play and they have to be willing to work together instead of running off on their own and dying so as long as you have friends to play with or find people playing who take it at least somewhat seriously then youll have a blast! the only bad thing is its starting to feel like train simlulator in terms of uneccesary dlc, i dont mind paying for a game but i hate being urged to buy useless crap by a developer i thought was above that.
Really fun game to play with your mates. plenty of guns to try out and loads of maps.

Honestly, I wish there was a neutral option. I recommend this game but at the same time I think it's important to mention it's shortcomings. 60 hours on record but I bought and played this when it first hit the market like 5 years ago. Since then, it has been microtransationed to all hell. Paying money for character skins like the chickenator and golden guns rather than unlocking them just isn't my idea of ethical or practical. Even if it's on sale you'll end up paying like $80 for everything. This is common nowadays so I won't spend all day going into it or the fact that there's ads for other games in the waiting lobbies.

Other than microtransations, the other negative would have to be the players. This game takes a lot strategy and time to master believe it or not, since map control will basically dictate your sucess. This is good if you have a squad of 3 dedicated players together, not so good if you're just randomly joining servers and expecting to win every game. Even some higher level players don't understand the concepts of sticking together and holding down an area or strategies as simple as pipe-bombing the Patriarch at the end to make for a speedy win. I can't tell you how many times I've sunk in 45 minutes into a round only for the squad to be wiped out the end because they thought they could take the Patriarch with pistols and MP7's. Reading the new players guide should be a pre-requisite for joining online matches.

At the end of the day, the amount of fun you will have with this game is going to be directly proportionl with two things: How much money you're willing to sink into it and the people you play it with.
